content:
of his life to find some alternative to it.
At present, few scientists share Einstein’s reservations.
One  of  the  most  important  and  fascinating  revolutions  in  science  was
Darwin’s theory of evolution through natural selection in biology. The Dar-
winian revolution challenged—and continues to challenge—many common
assumptions about the nature of science and also the nature of humankind.
As a result, Darwin’s views on evolution and natural selection encountered
vehement opposition right
